description: Incredible transformation of a Victorian end of terrace with multiple extensions at the rear, side and top transforming it into a beautiful contemporary home, with a nudge to the traditional. Inside is a veritable jungle!

events.name: Drop in: Open Day
events.notes: We will be limiting access to around 10 people at a time. On the roof terrace we will not be able to have more than 4-5 people at a time

factsheet.heading: About the Building
paragraphs:
Come and visit this intriguing, and quickly becoming iconic, home in Goose Green, East Dulwich. Situated at the corner of the Green with distant views and proximity to a Grade II listed church, the ambitious design had a complex but successful planning journey. It has become a private haven for the homeowner.  It is a contemporary home in a Victorian shell, bathed in light through out the day and kitted out with a full height lift from cellar to loft, a spa, double height glazed atrium and a roof terrace. However, the historic value of the house is retained and there are repeated nods to the local vernacular architecture of the surrounding Victorian buildings. 
Our architects will be showing you around and answering all of your questions!

travel_info: Additional travel info: A short walk from East Dulwich station and a slightly longer walk from Peckham Rye

name: 69 Adys Road
